result.markdown:
---
title: "HTML Cheatsheet"
---



# One Sample T-Test

# Data Type



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(dplyr)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```

Attaching package: 'dplyr'
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':

    filter, lag
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
The following objects are masked from 'package:base':

    intersect, setdiff, setequal, union
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
t.test(x = mtcars$mpg, mu = 33)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

	One Sample t-test

data:  mtcars$mpg
t = -12.117, df = 31, p-value = 2.712e-13
alternative hypothesis: true mean is not equal to 33
95 percent confidence interval:
 17.91768 22.26357
sample estimates:
mean of x 
 20.09062 
```


:::
:::



# Interpretation:

# t(df) = t, p, CI\[ll,uu\]

# Report: Mean Difference \| Mean

# Paired Sample T-Test



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ptt <- 
  tibble(
    t1 = rnorm(25,5,2),
    t2 = rnorm(25,7,2)
  )

# Comma Method
t.test(ptt$t1,ptt$t2,paired = TRUE)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

	Paired t-test

data:  ptt$t1 and ptt$t2
t = -2.798, df = 24, p-value = 0.009976
alternative hypothesis: true mean difference is not equal to 0
95 percent confidence interval:
 -2.3376438 -0.3529544
sample estimates:
mean difference 
      -1.345299 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Formula Method
t.test(Pair(t1,t2)  ~ 1, data = ptt)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

	Paired t-test

data:  Pair(t1, t2)
t = -2.798, df = 24, p-value = 0.009976
alternative hypothesis: true mean difference is not equal to 0
95 percent confidence interval:
 -2.3376438 -0.3529544
sample estimates:
mean difference 
      -1.345299 
```


:::
:::



# Independent Samples T-Test

# Data Type:

# Two Separate Data Samples



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Comma Method
with(ptt,t.test(t2,t1))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

	Welch Two Sample t-test

data:  t2 and t1
t = 2.5979, df = 47.592, p-value = 0.01245
alternative hypothesis: true difference in means is not equal to 0
95 percent confidence interval:
 0.3038702 2.3867280
sample estimates:
mean of x mean of y 
 6.871795  5.526496 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Function Method
# Make the Data Wide
ptt_long <- 
  ptt |> 
  tidyr::pivot_longer(cols = everything(),
                        names_to = "time",
                        values_to = "score")

t.test(score~time, data = ptt_long)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

	Welch Two Sample t-test

data:  score by time
t = -2.5979, df = 47.592, p-value = 0.01245
alternative hypothesis: true difference in means between group t1 and group t2 is not equal to 0
95 percent confidence interval:
 -2.3867280 -0.3038702
sample estimates:
mean in group t1 mean in group t2 
        5.526496         6.871795 
```


:::
:::



# ANOVA

# Data Type

# IV: 3 Levels



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
exp <- 
  tibble(
    grp = rep(c("SSLD","Placebo","Control"),each = 100),
    IQ = c(rnorm(100,120,5),
           rnorm(100,110,5),
           rnorm(100,110,5)) |> round(0)
  )
    
# Formula
# aov(DV ~ IV, data = data)

aov(IQ ~ grp, data = exp) |> 
  summary()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
             Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value Pr(>F)    
grp           2   5714  2856.9   128.4 <2e-16 ***
Residuals   297   6610    22.3                   
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```


:::
:::



# ANOVA's are Linear Regressions!



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
lm(IQ ~ grp, data = exp) |> 
  summary()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Call:
lm(formula = IQ ~ grp, data = exp)

Residuals:
   Min     1Q Median     3Q    Max 
-12.50  -2.97   0.03   3.06  12.50 

Coefficients:
            Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept) 110.5000     0.4717  234.24   <2e-16 ***
grpPlacebo    0.4400     0.6671    0.66     0.51    
grpSSLD       9.4700     0.6671   14.20   <2e-16 ***
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 4.717 on 297 degrees of freedom
Multiple R-squared:  0.4637,	Adjusted R-squared:   0.46 
F-statistic: 128.4 on 2 and 297 DF,  p-value: < 2.2e-16
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Follow-Up Tests
# Save the model, NOT the summary!
aov(IQ ~ grp, data = exp) |> 
  TukeyHSD()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  Tukey multiple comparisons of means
    95% family-wise confidence level

Fit: aov(formula = IQ ~ grp, data = exp)

$grp
                diff       lwr       upr     p adj
Placebo-Control 0.44 -1.131486  2.011486 0.7871012
SSLD-Control    9.47  7.898514 11.041486 0.0000000
SSLD-Placebo    9.03  7.458514 10.601486 0.0000000
```


:::
:::
